about.summary: Provides intuitive functions for caching R objects, encouraging reproducible, restartable, and distributed R analysis. The user selects a location to store caches, and then provides  nothing more than a cache name and instructions (R code) for how to produce the R object. Also provides some advanced options like environment assignments, recreating or reloading caches, and cluster compute bindings (using the 'batchtools' package) making it flexible enough for use in large-scale data analysis projects.

Provides intuitive functions for caching R objects, encouraging reproducible, restartable, and distributed R analysis. The user selects a location to store caches, and then provides  nothing more than a cache name and instructions (R code) for how to produce the R object. Also provides some advanced options like environment assignments, recreating or reloading caches, and cluster compute bindings (using the 'batchtools' package) making it flexible enough for use in large-scale data analysis projects.

name: r-simplecache
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.4.2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-simplecache
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/simpleCache_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/simpleCache/simpleCache_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 9f129c43fa648a882fba3798b0b9e710f9e74b717bcbc9be7e1d30862cc15e7d

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('simpleCache')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('simpleCache')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://www.github.com/databio/simpleCache
  license: BSD-2-clause
  summary: Provides intuitive functions for caching R objects, encouraging reproducible, restartable, and distributed R analysis. The user selects a location to store caches, and then provides  nothing more than a cache name and instructions (R code) for how to produce the R object. Also provides some advanced options like
    environment assignments, recreating or reloading caches, and cluster compute bindings (using the 'batchtools' package) making it flexible enough for use in large-scale data analysis projects.
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/BSD_2_clause
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: simpleCache
# Version: 0.4.1
# Date: 2019-02-26
# Title: Simply Caching R Objects
# Description: Provides intuitive functions for caching R objects, encouraging reproducible, restartable, and distributed R analysis. The user selects a location to store caches, and then provides  nothing more than a cache name and instructions (R code) for how to produce the R object. Also provides some advanced options like environment assignments, recreating or reloading caches, and cluster compute bindings (using the 'batchtools' package) making it flexible enough for use in large-scale data analysis projects.

# Suggests: knitr, testthat
# Enhances: batchtools
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# License: BSD_2_clause + file LICENSE
